Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you, half-lost in the swirling snow, stands a hooded figure wrapped in the eerie blue-black folds of a Glacier Shroud. Pale eyes flicker, reflecting the distant shimmer of the Obelisk of Veyra. He does not speak at first—only nods, then gestures with a gloved hand to the icy wastes.

After a silence that stretches, a low, gravelly voice finally emerges.

"Another soul braving the cold. You walk with purpose... or are you simply lost?"

Option.text: I'm here to help. Do you need anything done?
Are you always out here alone?
Your crossbow... I've never seen one like it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He tilts his head, a thin smile flickering.

"Help. Few offer, fewer mean it.
The tundra is never still. Now, something stirs that even the Frostguard avoid.
A FrostbittenSteed—once a wild mount, now twisted by Minax's cold shadow—haunts the northern pass. It tears through our traps, tramples our food stores, drives prey from the land.

I have tracked it for days. Yet even I cannot be everywhere."

He gestures at a crude map etched in ice at his feet.

Option.text: Tell me more about this Steed.
Why hasn't the militia dealt with it?
Why do you care so much?
I'll take care of the FrostbittenSteed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Fur like blue fire, hooves rimed in ice, breath that freezes water in the air.
It was a spirit of the north once, legend to the old tribes. Now—" his voice darkens, "now it runs mad with Minax's malice. It bites, tramples, leaves frostbite with every hoofprint.
If it is not stopped, others will turn. The Obelisk can only protect so much. We are not as safe as we pretend."

Option.text: I'll hunt the Steed for you.
Sounds dangerous. How did it get corrupted?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Bryndra's Frostguard are brave... but they fight what they see, not what they feel. The Steed is ghost-fast and clever. Steel alone won't catch it. Irinya says only one touched by the Obelisk—or willing to risk the freezing winds—can match its cunning.
And Kaelen? Kaelen would chase it until he froze, if I let him."

Option.text: How can I track the Steed?
I'm ready. Where do I start?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Hunter's hand tightens around his Icebark Crossbow.

"This land... was my sister's. She vanished when the Steed first turned. Some say she ran south; Irinya claims the Obelisk took her spirit. I keep watch for her, and for the rest who go missing in the snow.
We cannot lose more. Not to beasts, nor to Minax."

Option.text: I will help you. Give me the trail.
That's a heavy burden. Why stay in Frostmere?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Frostmere is the last refuge for those the world forgets.
Irinya says the Obelisk calls to all who are lost. Perhaps she is right. Or perhaps I am simply too stubborn to leave."

Option.text: All right. I will hunt the Steed.

Dialogue.NPCText: <BASEFONT COLOR='#6eb8db'> "Irinya hears the wind's true voice. She saw my path before I took it—warned me the Obelisk's touch would never fully leave me. I owe her my life. When the blizzards howl, I listen for her counsel... even when it frightens me." </BASEFONT>
"Wisdom is a rare coin in Frostmere. Spend it where you can."
"Often. But we both watch for what lurks beyond the edge of reason. Sometimes, that is enough."

The Hunter caresses the wood and bone of his crossbow.

"Icebark and iron. Forged by Garrik, tempered by Irinya's spells. Never misses in moonlight, sometimes refuses to fire if the quarry is unworthy.
Many things in Frostmere are stranger than they seem."
"If you return alive and prove your worth, perhaps Garrik and I will teach you. Survive first."

"Kaelen is hope in frost and folly. I save him when I can. He reminds me of who I was before the snows changed me.
If you see him, remind him—he owes me a flask of Lira's firebrew for every frostbite I kept him from."

"The Steed leaves ice-burned grass and bloodless bones. It fears fire, avoids the southern watchfires. At dusk, it haunts the Ruined Outpost, north ridge. Move quietly; it spooks at loud steps.
If you corner it, aim for the frost-spined mane—the heart lies beneath."

Option.text: I will bring proof of the kill.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Bring me its Frostbitten Mane. You'll have earned more than coin—perhaps a place among Frostmere's defenders."

"Minax's power seeps through cracks in the world. Some spirits are drawn to it, others are twisted by it.
The Steed fought off a pack of corrupted wolves two moons past—after that, it changed.
If you find tokens or runes on its body, bring them to Irinya. Some curses cling like shadows."

The Hunter nods with rare approval.

"North. Follow the wind's edge until the sky grows pale and the pines thin. The Steed circles the old Ruined Outpost at dusk.
Move in silence. Bring me its Frostbitten Mane, and you will have the gratitude of Frostmere—and of one who seldom trusts."

Option.text: I will return with its mane.
How will I recognize the Steed?
What dangers lie at the outpost?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The ice remembers footsteps, even those lost in storm. Return, and the shroud will lift a little."

He vanishes into the swirling snow, as silent as his name.

<BASEFONT COLOR='#6eb8db'> "The Ruined Outpost is older than Frostmere. Spirits linger there—echoes of warriors who froze in Minax's first winter. Watch for ice wraiths, and for hidden pits in the snow. If the Steed flees, do not follow into the deep rift. Few return." </BASEFONT>

Option.text: I'll keep my wits about me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Hunter doesn't answer right away.

Instead, he walks to a snow-covered ridge, staring into the frozen expanse.

"I was born under a different name. But names drift like smoke in the wind. The tundra... took mine."

Option.text: You don’t *want* to remember, do you?
Have you always been able to survive out here?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He touches the leather cord around his neck, where no pendant hangs.

"Not forgotten. Just... not mine anymore. The Obelisk gives and takes. Some hear words. I heard silence—and in it, I found peace."

Option.text: Did Irinya know you before you changed?

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Hunter’s expression hardens—but it’s not anger you see. It’s pain.

"You’ve sharp eyes. The snow covers much, but not all. What I lost... cannot be dug up like ice ore."

Option.text: Still... I'd like to know your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He nods, slow and respectful.
"It is rare, for someone to speak from heart. The cold has not taken yours—yet."

He chuckles quietly—like snow cracking beneath boots.

"No one is born ready for this cold. You either learn to hear it whisper, or you become part of the ice. I listened... and it taught me things no blade can."

"How to move without sound. How to read the snow like scripture. How to vanish. How to kill only when needed—and how to *not* kill, when that matters more."

He finally turns to look you in the eyes.
"If you keep walking in this land, you'll learn too. Or you won’t come back."

Option.text: I’d like to learn. Can you teach me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Spirit touches spirit. Yours still stirs with flame, but there is wind in your soul too.
I can show you how to listen better—to the Obelisk, to the world, to yourself."

You feel a subtle warmth enter your mind, as if a silent presence had just acknowledged you.

Option.text: (You feel more attuned to the Obelisk.)
Thank you. I’ll use it well.
Option.action: SendMessage:The Obelisk stirs faintly within you.

Option.text: Let’s talk about the FrostbittenSteed now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He shrugs. "Perhaps. But if it is a curse, it is one I chose when I stayed behind.
When others fled south after the Blizzard War, I remained. I heard the wind's voice. It told me: 'You are not done.'"

"She heard more than I. Irinya... she *felt* the Obelisk’s pulse before it ever called to me.
I follow her not because she commands, but because she sees—what is, and what *may be*."

A pause.
"Yes. I would walk into the storm for her, though she’d tell me not to. But we speak little of such things. In Frostmere, survival comes first. Always."

Option.text: That’s all I needed to hear.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The Hunter's gaze sharpens.

"You know. Or at least, you suspect.
The Gem of Immortality shattered more than the world. It broke fate. Every shard bears a path. The Obelisk is... one such path."

A cold wind rushes by you—but your skin prickles not from chill, but from awareness.

Option.text: What does it want from you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"To witness. To walk. To endure. Perhaps to warn others... or to stop something before it awakens again.
Maybe I’m not the hunter. Maybe I’m the bait."

Option.text: Let’s move on. Tell me about the FrostbittenSteed.
